result.execSummary:
The defendant David LeRoy Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 28 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant may not operate a motor vehicle without a valid DL.

The defendant must obtain his DL.

The defendant must undergo anger management and follow thru with any all recommendations.

The defendant must attend a domestic abuse program and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Defendant David LeRoy Brown in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:58 AM. State - all matters resolved. Lucareli - 15CT20 - plead to only count with a $500 plus costs; 15CM107 - count #1 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle with a forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs, #2 - dismiss; 15CM112 - count #1 - plead NC as alleged,  withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months  - concurrent to Dodge County case with conditions of: 30 days in FC jail - consecutive to Dodge County case, #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $500 forfeiture plus costs, #3 - plead to as alleged - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to count #1, with conditions of costs only; 15CM157 - count #1 - amend to county ordinance of DC with forfeiture of $1000 plus costs, count #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC with forfeiture of $1000 fine plus costs, DRI remaining counts - (#3 - #7); 15CM180 - plead to OAR (count #!) and one BJ (#3) with court costs only on each count and dismiss remaining counts. State has complied with victim notification requirements and one victim is present in the Courtroom with no VIS and victim in Court does not wish to make a statement today. Lucareli mentions 28 days credit on 15CM180/15CM157. Court reviews Dodge County case in CCAP and will consider credit if revoked. Court  - 15CM107 - dismiss count #2, amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $1000.00 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO; 15CM157 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeitures of $1000.00 plus costs - apply any bond posted - remainder due in 90 days/CO, dismiss counts #3 thru #7; 15CT20 - pleads NC to only count; 15CM112 - amend count #2 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $500 plus costs - 120 DTP/CO, pleads NC to count #1 as alleged and pleads NC to count #3 as alleged; 15CM180 - pleads NC to count #1 as alleged and pleads NC to count #3 as alleged, court dismisses counts #2, #4, #5 and #6. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Lucareli makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Brown makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CT20 - fine of $500 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 120 days/CO; 15CM112 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditons of: 30 days in jail - consecutive to jail time on Dodge County Case #15CT412 - 28 days credit only if revoked - huber allowed , obtain DL, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru and domestic abuse program, no operation of a motor vehicle with valid DL, 100 hours of community service, costs, count #3 - costs, 15CM180 - costs only on count #1 - take bond posted - remainder due in 120 days/CO, #3 - costs only - remainder due in 120/days/CO, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant David LeRoy Brown in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FTR recorded. Called 15CM157, 15CT20, 15CM112, 15CM107 & 15CM180. Called 10:33 AM. Lucareli makes statement in regards to warrant issued on 12/7/15, indicates he was arrested 12/1/15, informed Stenz he was not here on 12/7/15 due to being incarrcerated in another county but a warrant was issued anyway, has contacted the DA to request modification of bond multiple times, updates court of other case in another county, bond that was posted was borrowed from family members for warrant that was issued on 12/7/15, sent DA email asking for stipulation on modification of bond. State - wasn't aware of incarrceration in Dodge County on 12/7/15 date, warrant was issued due to non appearance, has no comment in regards to conversations with Lucareli and feels motion should have been filed and objects to the modification of bond. Lucareli - Brown was wanted on warrant and under law can appear at anytime. Court - denies motion of modification of bond at this time due to not following proper proceedure.
from victim's sister to court
Jury trial at 03-10-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CM107, 15CM180, 15CM112, 15CT20 and 15CM157. Called 9:08 AM. State - was just made aware that defendant was picked up on a warrant and is sitting in Dodge County. 15CM180 & 15CM157 hear for INIT appearances, all others were set for FPT. Lucareli suggests adjourning. All cases set for FPT will be set for JT (15CM112, 15CT20 & 15CM107) 15CM112 will be first and others to be scheduled that day as backups. INIT appearance cases to be set for FPT. State asks for a warrant on 15CM180 & 15CM157. Lucareli does not object but asks that bond money not be forfeited. Court issues bench warrant body or $500 on 15CM180 & 15CM157. Bond will not be forfeited at this time.  Jury trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Bond continued on each case.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant David LeRoy Brown not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:57 PM. Also called 15CM112 and 15CT20. Court was instructed that defense counsel's secretary called JA Cook instructing that he was not available for today's hearing and asked that it be rescheduled. Court - defendant should have been in Court today and heard request for adjournment on the record, defendant or defense counsel were not given permission from the Court not to appear. Court forfeits any bond posted, issues bench warrant body or $500.00 on each case.

Defendant David LeRoy Brown in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:56 AM. Also called 15CF106, 15CT20 and 15CM107. 15CM107 - Brown has complaint - Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Brown understands charges and penalties. 15CM112 - reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Brown understands charges and penalties. 15CT20 - reads charges and penalities and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Brown understands charges and penalties. Brown will be hiring his own counsel (Steve Lucareli). Court sets all matters for AIA on 8/3/15 at 1:30 PM. Court gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney at the next hearings. Court - bond on 15CM107 - $250.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol. State moves to dismiss 15CF106 and asks that that bond be moved to 15CM112. Court - dismisses 15CF106, sets bond on 15CM112 at $1000 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol, 15CT20 - Court - bond - $250.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
